1123121.title: Batman: Arkham Asylum

choices: "I'm gonna stomp your face into the ground. And I think I'll do it barefoot!"
"Not today B-Man! I gotta make sure you don't mess up our plans!"
11231211.content:
As the image of the maniacal Joker vanished off of the T.V monitor, you couldn’t help but heave an almost sympathetic sigh for the now scorned Harley Quinn, who must be fuming behind the doors now that her “Mr. J” had finally deserted her, leaving her to the wolves. You could only imagine the pent up aggression brewing within her, that same aggression now being channeled into an ill-fated vendetta against you.
The doors flew open, releasing the now feral Quinn, who sprinted towards you at a breakneck pace.
“Die you big ugly bat!” she sneered while running at you.
It was almost superhuman how she was able to contort her body into a running cartwheel, before performing a backflip. The metal in her sexualized nurse uniform jingled almost rhythmically against her steps as she came at you.
You almost irritably rolled his eyes as the elusive yet seductive Harley Quinn continued to run at you.
Preparing to use Quinn’s momentum against her, you continued to stand, waiting for Harley to make the first (and last) move in your confrontation. Assuming the position to combat her offense, you prepared to block her kick.
Just when things couldn’t be more perfect, a wrench was thrown into your plan in the form of a lone inmate.
As she neared you, one of the inmates who miraculously managed to recover from the beatdown grabbed your leg, preventing you from moving forward. His face was a squashed tomato, but somehow, he remained loyal to her, sacrificing himself. Crouching next to him, you grabbed his throat with one hand, cocking the other behind your head.
Snarling, you snuffed out his brief resistance with a well-aimed punch to the head.
Still, the inmate’s sacrifice was not all for naught. Turning back towards Harley, you realized that it was you underestimated her distance from you, and as a result, paid the price for underestimating the feisty fatale. With a cry, she maneuvered her body into a flying weapon, her legs aimed straight at you.
Her heeled boot cracked off the side of your head, her entire body weight behind the flying heel kick. The momentum behind the kick also caused you to stagger backwards, her boot digging into your cheek.
Wincing, you nearly crumpled to the floor, but managed to ground yourself on both feet. Rubbing the bruise on your cheek, you cursed yourself, severely underestimating Quinn’s ability as a fighter.
Quinn landed on her feet, a victorious smirk on her face as she realized that the kick connected.
“Did that hurt, Bat-Brain? I hope so, Mistah J’s gonna hurt you a lot worse when he’s done with you,” she smirked, lunging at you again.
This time however, you were wise to her antics, and as soon as she tried the flying heel kick, you sidestepped it, using her own momentum against her. You grabbed her ankle in mid-air, changing her trajectory by throwing her overhead.
Harley’s head bounced off the metal rails as she crashed into the railing, her body crumpling like a paper bag. She whimpered in pain, rubbing her head.
“Not as much as I’m gonna hurt you if you don’t tell me where Joker is,” you snarled, a fiery resolution in your eyes, as you wiped a drop of blood from his lips.
“Hey, what was that for?” she demanded angrily, rubbing the side of her head still aching.
Your hands clenched, you stalked towards the downed Harley.
“Where is he?” you demanded once more, your voice growing increasingly infuriated.
“Why do you think I know, Bat-freak?” she growled, silently reaching behind her back.
Mentally rolling your eyes at her predictability, you nevertheless gave her the benefit of the doubt as you neared her.
“You’re going to tell me, or you don’t walk for the next 6 months!” he threatened, grabbing her arm.
“How about I just slice you up instead?” she snarled, lunging at you with the knife.
With ease, you used her momentum as leverage, grabbing her wrist and twisting it backwards as soon as the blade slashed through the air. Before Harley could even react, you easily twisted her arm behind her back, your hand still grasping her wrist with an ironclad grip. She desperately swung at you with her other arm, but that proved to be futile, as you grabbed her other arm, unapologetically snapping it behind her back.
Now in full control, you continued to twist Harley’s arms behind her back as leverage, pain contorting through her face. She struggled tenaciously, but your sheer muscle power overpowered her flexibility.
Harley shrieked in pain, but you paid her no mind, your only priority being to locate the Joker.
“Drop it!” you growled in her ear, referring to the knife she was still holding.
Reluctantly, Harley dropped the knife, the blade clanging against the cold floor.
“I’m gonna ask one more time Quinn. Where is Joker?” you growled, jerking her elbow forward for emphasis.
“How should I know?” she retorted.
“Let me think. You’re Joker’s own personal cheerleader, you practically worship the ground he walks on. Anytime he needs an asset to help solve his problems, or a punching bag for him to exhaust his anger, you’re his go-to gal, aren't you?” you snarled.
“Shut up,” she whispered back, stifling back a sniffle as some of your words started to hit home.
Still, you knew the cerebral game better than anyone, and this sort of mental dissection was the only way to get to Joker.
“Lets face reality Harley, because from what I can see, you’re way out of it. Joker doesn't give a crap whether anyone, not even you. You think he cares about you, you’re more delusional and gullible than I thought. He only cares about himself and his own personal agenda, and you, you’re just a stepping stone to those goals. Face facts Harleen, you’re just a tool,” you continued.
“Shut up,” she repeated, her voice becoming hardened.
“Joker doesn't care about you. If he did, then why do I see the bruises running down your back, the scars on your chest? You’re nothing more than an expendable pawn Harleen, and I’d hate to be the one to break it to you, but Joker doesn't give a crap of whether you live or die in here,” you finished, continuing your mental dissection of her.
“SHUT UP!” she suddenly yelled, taking you by surprise.
Before you could react, she rammed her head backwards, catching you in the nose with a headbutt. You could feel the blood running down your nose, decorating your already battle-scarred face. You staggered backwards, but kept your grip on her.
Taking advantage, Harley ran her feet up the rails, using that you lift her body over yours. Kicking off the rails, she jumped into the air, freeing her arms in the process. Her flexibility soon became her ace in the hole, as she landed on the ground behind you.
Now with the upper hand, Harley shoulder tackled you, focusing all of her body weight into ramming your sides into the metal rails.
You grunted as your head bounced off the metal, your face dangerously close to the barbed wire. In a twist of irony, Harley twisted your arm behind your back, keeping you glued to the wall. With the other hand, Harley smeared your cheek against the metal, trying to force it into the barbed wire surrounding it.
“You think you know me, huh B-Man? You think your little ‘mind games’ will work on me? Mistah J loves me, he just gets a bit cranky when things don’t turn out the way they’re supposed to. But that’s alright, I can make it all better again, once you’re dead,” she snarled angrily.
Recovering from her surprise attack, you took advantage of her amateur hold, you reared your other arm back, smashing her face with a hard elbow.
As soon as she relinquished her hold, you sprang into action, turning at her and connecting with a harsh backfist to the cheek.
Harley nearly crumpled to the ground, her hands and knees the only things still holding her up. She sorely rubbed the bruise on her cheek where your fist had hit her.
Before you could finish her, she suddenly buried her face in her hands, crying out loud. Her cries failed to phase you, as you continued to cock your fist back. Still, you had already disarmed her of her only visible weapon, and you could just as easily suppress another surprise attack.
“You hit just like Mistah J. He never held back either,” she whimpered, her face still buried in her palms. Her stifled cries started to awaken a streak of sympathy, perhaps pity within you. You knew of the abusive relationship sustained between the two, it remained an enigma to you. Most of the time, you would arrive to foil their schemes only to find Harley just as beat up as the other henchmen. And yet, something kept Harley going back to him, almost like she needed the psychopath. It befuddled you how this could be, and yet, it seemed to be clear to Harley.
Finally, you decided to take a more diplomatic approach, approaching her in a friendly yet cautious way. With one arm, you started to wrap it around her shoulder, comforting her as she cried.
“Then again, he never hesitated!” she suddenly yelled, lunging at you.
Cursing yourself for being so naive, you found yourself the victim of a sharp roundhouse kick to the face, her red boot just burying itself into your mouth. The kick almost downed you, but you only caught the very tip of her boot.
The blow sent you reeling backward, allowing for Harley to kip up, a clever grin on her face. Staggering backwards, you wiped the line of blood from your mouth, cursing yourself for letting your guard down.
Dropping to one knee, you spat out a glob of blood as she sauntered towards you, her hips swaying.
“Would you look at that, Bats? Your thick skull nearly broke my shoe,” she sneered, running her hand down her thigh, all the way down to her knee high red boot, which seemed to be even looser. Bending down, she ran her fingers down the metal straps, some of which seemed to be unzipped.
“Lets make this interesting B-Man," she grinned mischievously, starting to unzip her boot.
"You really want to do this the hard way Quinn?" you sighed, cracking your knuckles.
Harley laughed before uttering her next statement.
11231211.title: Harley Quinn: Arkham Asylum

choices: You barely managed to block the kick!
112312111.content:
Lunging at her with a Superman punch to the jaw, a seemingly routine way to end conflicts, Harley countered accordingly, using her agility to duck the fist as it sliced through the air. Using the momentum, she continued to stretch herself forward, until she could touch her toes.
Bringing her left leg forward, she then nailed you with a scorpion kick, a move only achieved by the most flexible of martial artists, by shooting her left foot over her back and directly into your face. In doing so, she literally performed a handstand so she could keep balance.
You tasted blood while staggering backwards, the kick catching you off guard. Literally tasting her boot in your mouth, you finally managed to create distance between her, as you tried to rethink your plan.
An irritable growl carved into your face as Harley stood up and mockingly bowed, a clever grin painted on her face.
“I’m curious, whatcha’ think B-Man? 6? 7? I think extra points should go to you, it really looked like it hurt!” she sneered, as you wiped a drop of blood from your mouth.
“I’m warning you Quinn, I don’t have time for your little ‘games.’ I want to know where Joker is. If you’re not willing to talk, you should know that I know other ways to get it out of you,” you growled, already irritated about wasting so much time dealing with her.
“The only way to get to Mistah J B-Man, is through me. And you’re not getting past me!” she snarled back, her hands on her hips.
You almost smirked at her cockiness, but you couldn’t afford a witty retort. Joker was out and about, and unfortunately, the only information about his current whereabouts was through Harley. You of all people should not mistake her flirty nature for weakness, but time was running short, and you couldn’t afford to pull punches.
Deciding to end this quick and mercifully (for her), you mockingly beckoned her with your fingers, smirking slightly as an indignant expression formed on her face.
“You think I’m a joke, don’t you? Well, lets see who's laughing after I’m done pounding your skull in!” she yelled.
With a cry, she took the offensive, breaking into a cartwheel to gain momentum. Landing on her feet, she continued to run at you at a frenzied pace, giving you enough time to accept a battle stance.
Upon arrival, Harley lashed out at you with a quick flurry of punches and kicks, starting with a spinning heel kick that would’ve knocked out Muhammad Ali in his prime. You just barely managed to block it with a quick forearm to the ankle, but that was only the beginning.
She continued throwing kicks at you, her feet practically dancing as they fired at you on all cylinders. Thanks to your superior technique, you were able to parry every single one with a well-timed open hand slap, but she prevented you from countering by throwing fisticuffs at you.
Blocking one of her low kicks with one hand, you were unable to prevent Harley from landing a quick lab to the mouth with her right fist, her knuckles nearly breaking a tooth. Gritting your teeth angrily, you proceeded to violently back-slap her as soon as you ducked her roundhouse to the face, her nose practically running into your fist.
Stumbling backwards, the blow nearly took Harley out, but she managed to ground herself on one knee before completely collapsing.
“That was good,” she remarked, her eyes still glimmering insanely in the heat of battle.
Now with renewed ferocity, she lunged at you again, this time assaulting you with relentless kicks to the side and knees. Her uncanny speed and quickness catching you off guard, you were barely able to block her attacks, this time Harley had managed to get the advantage.
She feigned a hard round kick to the sides, to which you instinctively blocked with one hand, only for your palm to hit open air as she pulled out at the last possible second. Not realizing your mistake until a second later, you winced as she instead twisted her leg in mid-air, her heel instead connecting against the side of your head.
Staggering back a step, a wave of dizziness had clouded your vision for a second as the kick bounced off your temple, allowing Harley to follow up with a devastating spinning heel kick to the face.
Your head rolled sideways as her foot once again cracked against it, your eyes squinting to see Harley rise to her feet, a proud look on her face.
“That was better,” she mocked, once again taunting you by making the beckoning motion with her fingers.
Just seeing Quinn outsmart you like that enraged you, causing you to impulsively race at her with clenched fists.
You swung at her wildly, only for the flexible fatale to fall back on her palms while in a stretched position, once again emphasizing her flexibility. Cursing yourself for abandoning technique, you managed to pull the fist back before your momentum could betray you.
Now on the ground, Harley winked at you before bringing her knees up and smashing both feet into your stomach, knocking the wind out of you. Nearly doubling over, you found yourself straining for breath for a moment as her feet rammed into your torso.
Jumping to her feet, Harley noticed you doubling over, and tilted her head curiously. A second later, she ran at you, but instead of attacking, using your back as a backboard to flip over. Her back touched yours, as she rolled off your spine, now behind you.
Before you could respond with a back elbow, she connected first with a spinning heel kick to both knees, causing them to buckle. Landing on your back, your vision became blurry as your head bounced off the concrete. The ceiling light dominated your vision, but you could barely make out a sneering Harley next to you, lifting her boot as if preparing for the coup de grace.
“Lucky for you B-Man, I can’t rough you up too much for Mistah J’s surprise party. But I intend on leaving you a souvenir to remind me by!” she laughed insanely, stomping down on your face with her purple boot.
Instinctively, you rolled to your side as her boot slammed into the pavement, letting you catch your breath.
“Hey no fair! You weren't supposed to-” Quinn complained, only for you to kick out her legs from under her mid-sentence. With an “Uuummphhh”, Quinn fell on her side right next to you, moaning as her head bounced off the pavement.
Before she could recover, you jumped on her, quickly assuming the dominant position on top and pinning her wrists.
“Hey get off me, you creep!” she screamed, trying to maneuver her body from under you. She twisted her head back and forth as you cocked one fist overhead, ready to punch her.
She struggled incessantly, but your sheer weight had outweighed her struggles. She continued to struggle, trying weakly to wedge her knees in between her and you in order to kick you away.
But before you could finish her, you noticed something out of your peripheral vision. During her struggling, something had briefly popped out of her cleavage. Squinting your eyes, you managed to stop the tip of a sheet of paper,
“Hey, hands off the merchandise!” Harley protested, but you paid her no mind.
You quickly grabbed the shriveled up sheet of paper and with one hand, held it up to your eyes. Unrolling it, you saw a whole list of names.
“This must be Joker’s party list!” you figured out silently, as your eyes darted off the list, noticing the names that had been “crossed out.”
“You weren't supposed to read that B-Man!” she argued, only for you to unapologetically clamp her mouth shut with one hand.
With one hand off of her wrists, Harley started to reach into her pocket, her fingers wrapping around something small. Oblivious to you, she slowly revealed another gadget of her quite expansive inventory, a can of pepper spray.
“Why the smiles nex-?” you started to demand, only for Harley to reply by spraying you in the face with pepper spray.
Yelling out loud, you quickly shield your face with both arms to prevent another face full. Now with her legs free, Harley easily kicked you off of her, but you hardly protested it.
Thankfully, your cowl prevented the spray from entering your eyes, but it had still managed to cloud your visor vision, giving Quinn time to scurry away from you on her elbows and knees.
Wiping the liquid from your mouth, you finally switched back to normal after noticing how she was getting out of your reach. Before she could make it back to her feet, you grabbed her ankle, keeping her anchored to you. She protested sharply, turning on her back and only mildly annoying you with kicks from her free foot.
“You just can’t get enough of me, can you B-Man?” she yelled in between kicks.
“Where’s Joker?” you demanded, only to receive a boot to the face as a response.
Now agitated by her naive loyalty to the Joker, you started to reel her back in like a fish, only for her to increase her struggles tenfold. Now lashing out with several shots to the head, you could only hold on for so long, and your grip on her leg was decreasing.
“Mistah J doesn't want you ruining the surprise, so he hired me to keep you occupied, idiot! In case you’re still dense-headed, here’s a reminder!” she laughed, bringing her knee back all the way back to her chest before launching it directly at you.
As her boot connected with your nose, you were forced to relinquish the hold, reeling backwards in order to tend to the now broken nose caused by the jester. As you howled in pain, she managed to crawl away.
Rolling on your back, you ran your fingers under your mask, only to find them bloodstained seconds later. Cursing wildly, you tried to wipe the blood from your face.
“I’m gonna make you bleed for that, B-Man!” she yelled to the left of you.
Turning towards Harley, you instead saw the toe of her boot embed itself within your ribs, causing you to collapse to the ground. You grunted as you felt yourself being turned over on your back by her foot.
Glaring almost helplessly at her, you snarled as she raised her red boot once again to stomp on you.

(Feel free to review)

choices: Harley takes advantage of your susceptibility to female feet to defeat you!
You instead decide to restrain her and worship her bare feet!
1123121111.content:
Just in the nick of time were you able to block the kick, instead grabbing her ankle with one hand before just before it touched your cheek.
"Hey no fair!" she complained.
“This ends now, Harley!” you snarled, a determined look in your eyes, as you launched both feet at her, knocking her off her feet with the double blow.
Crumpling to the floor like paper, you could hear Harley hit the metal railing instead of the floor, sympathetically cringing as her head bounced off of the metal railing. Hearing her faint moans, you sighed, knowing that you managed to buy yourself some time.
Clutching your sides, you spat out a glob of blood as you rolled over on your stomach, trying to recover.
Resting your head against the tiles for a second, you sorely rubbed your now broken nose, subsequently cursing yourself for underestimating Quinn, especially at such a high-risk situation like this.
Reaching into your utility belt, you produced some gauze from one of your pockets, a successful method of suppressing the bleeding, at least for now. Quickly stuffing it inside your cowl, you made sure to spread it over your nose so it can soak up any blood.
Your face paler than usual thanks to Harley’s barrage of kicks, you spat out another glob of blood before clambering to your feet, leaning on the metal rails for support. After sighing in utter exasperation after being stalled so long, you turned to Quinn, who was also leaning on the rails for support.
Luckily for you, it seemed like Harley was just as fatigued as you, as indicated by her body language.
She was barely able to stand on two feet, and it seemed like her acrobatic moveset had finally taken its toll on the vixen. You could hear her panting while leaning against the railing, her body constantly deflating as she inhaled and exhaled. She also grabbed the back of her head, which seemed to be the exact spot where her head first bounced off the pavement. You could spot a bulging bruise starting to form on her neck, ever the more reason to capitalize on this sudden streak of luck.
Pushing yourself off the metal rails, you started to make your way over to Harley, who was still using the railing as a crutch to stay on her feet. Your cape dragged as you stealthily crept over to her, your fists clenching anxiously as you prepared to neutralize her once and for all. She was already too busy panting heavily to even notice you, an opportunity that would not present itself again.
She nearly collapsed as soon just as you started to lunge at her, her knees buckling violently. Still hanging on to the railing, she tried unsuccessfully to pull herself up, only for her legs to start trembling again, probably from the dizziness now circulating through her head.
You briefly caught a glimpse of her face as she tried to stand her. Instead of the usual smug expression or childish sneer, you instead saw a grim snarl, emphasized by the utter look of defeat on her face. Her eyes now glared at you almost sadly, as she evidently realized the reality of her situation, that she failed her pudding.
“Go ahead Batman, finish me off! It’s what you’re going to do to Mistah J, isn't it? Hit me again, I double dare you. It won’t be the first time, I can guarantee you that!” she snarled defiantly, managing to raise one fist.
“Harley, you’re hurting yourself here. Tell me where Joker is, and I can promise you that I won’t hurt him, as long as he doesn't hurt me,” you deliberately lied, trying to appease the already unpredictable and irate Quinn.
“You think I’m that gullible B-Man?” she demanded.
“I think you’re tired Harley, tired of all the pain and abuse Joker’s put you through. I know I am. I can make that stop, but you need to help me. I can bring him in, unscathed, not a bruise on his body, if you cooperate. Help me, and I can promise you that once this is all cleaned up, I can help you,” you implored, trying to appeal to Quinn’s better judgement. Unfortunately for you, you still doubted she even had one.
“Y-you won’t hurt my pudding?” she stammered, shocked by your compromise.
“You have my word,” you replied solemnly. analyzed the idea in her head, the thought at least piquing her attention.
“Really, well….?” she gaped, trying to comprehend every word that you just said, as well as the words that she would say.
“Just like reeling in a fish,” you smirked silently, as she twirled her ponytails. Finally, a look of resolution appeared on yo
Well, when you put it like that…...” she started to say, before suddenly kicking you in the gut.
“Sorry B-Man, but I only answer to one man, and that’s Mistah J!” she yelled.
Lurching backwards, you once again cursed yourself for uncharacteristically letting your guard once again. She had played possum, and like a novice, you had fell right into her trap. Your hands clutching your stomach, you found yourself unprepared to prevent her next onslaught of acrobatic offense.
Snarling wildly, you blindly swung at her as she ran at you to finish her combo, her body easily evading the blow by ducking underneath your armpit. Before you could retract the fist, she suddenly shot up with a savage uppercut to the chin, her fist carving itself into your jaw.
Staggering backwards, you managed to wiped a drop of blood from your mouth as she swung at you again with a hard-hitting haymaker. This time, your veteran experience kicked in, and you managed to intercept the blow in mid-air with an expertly timed karate chop.
Before she could try again, you lashed forward on your other hand with another karate chop, this time your palm hit her elbow with considerable force. She instantly shrieked in pain, retreating backwards as her right arm instantly went limp.
“Ow! What did you do to me, Bat-freak?” she growled, clutching her now limp arm as it dangled helplessly in the air.
“I just hit one of your many pressure points Quinn. This one is a personal favorite of mine. It can remove all feeling from the victim’s arm for hours on end. In your case however, you won’t be able to feel the rest of your body in the next five minutes,” you explained smugly, relishing in her moment of vulnerability as she glared at you resentfully.
“You’re gonna pay for that B-Man!” she promised, lunging at you yet again despite her unmoving arm.
She almost desperately swung at you with her other arm, only for you to easily slap it away with another karate chop. Yelling at you irritably, she attempted a roundhouse to the face, only for you to expertly duck just as her foot swung through the air.
As she landed, you waited until the right moment before finally countering with a decisive fist to the face as soon as her momentum finished twirling her around. As your knuckles smashed into her face, you cringed as you felt her skin crumble behind it, her nose feeling gooey as it touched your glove.
With a cry, she fell face first on the pavement, her body nearly growing limp in the process. Her hair was now in ruins, her blonde hair sprawled around the floor. She still remained stirring, which only further infuriated you.
“It’s over Quinn!” you snarled irritably, as she rolled herself over on her back.
“Not until….the fat lady sings!” she retorted once again, bringing her legs up and kicking you directly in the groin.
Thanks to your protective cup, the impact was mercilessly lessened, but only by so much. As both soles of her foot smashed against your groin, you still felt a surge of pain emitting there, and your hands instantly dropped down to it. The surprise move had still stunned you, enough to bring you down to your knees.
Now at her level, Quinn took advantage by tattooing your face with another vicious kick before turning over on her belly and crawling away. You reeled back, and managed to fall back on your elbows, you fingers grabbing the gauze to make sure she didn't further injure your nose. Thankfully, the gauze held strong. You still noticed her attempting to flee from you, and a blind rage began brewing inside of you.
Incensed at her resiliency as well as stubbornness, you grabbed onto her ankle, refusing to let her go. Your fingers tightened around her boot, as your sheer weight held her in place.
Turning towards you, Harley howled in frustration as she attempted to kick you off.
“Why won’t you just leave me alone Batman?” she cried, as you continued holding on to her leg.
“Because you won’t let me,” you answered, now grabbing her leg with both hands.
Harley desperately clung on to the metal railing, her fingertips barely able to touch, as you tried dragging her back towards her.
Oblivious to you, your incessant pulling had loosened all the straps on her purple boot, the shoe slowly sliding off as you continued holding on to her.
Harley turned over on her sides and continued kicking you with her free foot, only for you to lean back out of her ranger, much to her chagrin.
“Stay still B-Man!” she cried, as you finally managed to pry her fingers off the railing.
Just as her fingers were forced off, she immediately tried to grab on to them again, only for you to easily pull her back.
“You’re finished Harley,” you snarled, raising your fist as a symbolic coup de grace.
Her eyes widened in fear, but just before you could deal the finishing blow, her purple boot suddenly popped off, along with her fishnet stockings attached to it.

(Feel free to review, critique, or comment on. I always reply to any e-mails, and you're always welcome to add on to my stories. From the looks of it, I hope that I represented the Arkham version of Quinn well. If you have any suggestions, feel free to e-mail me. Thanks again for reading my excessively long stories! :)

112321212.content:
The sound of footsteps echoed throughout the vacant street, each step a rapid stomping onto the ground quite akin to that of a wild herd of wildebeests running about on an African safari. The steps were hurried, rushed, almost like something, or something was giving chase to this mysterious figure. It was the middle of the night in Gotham City, with a raucous thunderstorm not yet relinquishing its grip over the crime-infested city. The skies were lit up with occasional streaks of lightning, which struck down on the Earth with a fiery intensity.
Eventually stopping to lean next to a parked car, the figure quickly turned over the shoulder, obviously keeping an eye out for whoever, or whatever might be chasing after it. Another bolt of lightning illuminated the figure, revealing none other than Poison Ivy.
Clad from head to toe in green, she almost nervously scanned the area for any signs of him. She leaned in on the rear view window of the vehicle to get a better look at herself. Her face was almost painted with a certain look that can only be achieved by meeting him, a look of fear. Her forehead was visibly dripping with sweat, and her mouth was curled almost in an uncharacteristic whimper. Her body inhaled beneath her green almost signature spandex costume. She wore a thick brown trench coat concealing her spandex outfit, probably to remain conspicuous. Ironically enough, this plan seemed to have backfired, given the company that was tailing her.
Ivy almost nervously tried to smooth out her red hair, but just as her hand waved a few strands away from her face, a familiar blur suddenly popped out of the corner of her eye. Thanks to the car’s reflection, she was able to make out its iconic two bat-shaped ears.
Instinctively, she twirled around, rolling down her coat sleeve. Attached to her right wrist was her signature repeating crossbow, the metallic ring glimmering in the darkness. She expertly aimed it towards the shadows, her thumb just itching to press down on the pressure pad, to activate it.
“Thought you could catch a single woman like me off-guard, did you Batman?” She demanded, her arm fixed firmly on the corner of the street that she just saw him.
“Why don’t you stop acting like a coward and face Mother Nature, meat-sack,” she proclaimed, trying to make her words as threatening as possible to hide the nervousness inside of her.
She kept the crossbow aimed at the shadows, but after a few moments of silence, no movement had been detected.
“Face me Batman!” she demanded, almost out of desperation but the only response
she got was the continued downpour of rain, the droplets pounding against the sidewalk. Her voice only echoed through the street, which had been devoid of human life for over 2 hours.
Reluctantly, she took a deep breath and shrugged off that instinctive response inside of her, somewhat assured that he wasn't there, that he was probably off somewhere else in Gotham. She heaved a sigh almost out of relief, before backing away, each step careful and precise.
Still not completely assured, she kept her eyes fixed on the street, her crossbow still trained in front of her. Her eyes darted from left to right, up to down, even up to the rooftops. As another round of thunder crackled, she eventually lowered her crossbow, coming to the conclusion that she was simply imagining things, a hallucination if anything else. Her paranoia must be catching up to her.
Combing back her fiery red hair, she cracked a nervous smile before turning around to see:

11232122111.content:
“And that’s how I almost got him,” finished the seductive Poison Ivy, after recounting her latest encounter with the Dark Knight to the trifecta of tyranny and terror. She wiggled comfortably in her light green outfit, as she crossed her legs.
The malevolent yet binary Two-Face smirked matter-of-factly at her as he continued to toss his signature two-piece coin into the air, now symbolic of his distorted sense of right and wrong. The condescending and slightly amused Penguin merely chuckled in his corner, while shuffling up a new set of playing cards, a cigarette loose in his mouth. The maniacal yet always comedic Joker giggled under his breath, his bleached white skin a surprising standout in the crowd of dastardly villains. The cannibalistic Killer Croc stared at her, his blank expression indicative of his simplistic yet feral behavior.
“With exploding pumpkins?” came the Joker’s mocking reply, his cynical tone laced with every word that he spoke.
“I would've hit him with a rock,” interjected Killer Croc.
He glared around the table hopefully, only to receive a murderous glare from Two-Face, a playful smirk from Ivy, and a pondering look from Penguin. Joker merely laughed, as he always did.
“Yes, despite Croc’s idiocy, your plan while intriguing in theory, was rather…...incomplete. Your little pumpkins, while cute, simply lack a sense of theatricality. Exploding pumpkins, how cliched. And your execution, how horrendous. Overlooking such a textbook mistake like his Batmobile was your first downfall, but not even having a contingency plan in case you failed? Honestly, if you wanted a more original plan you should’ve asked Croc to throw a rock at him,” the opulent and quite extravagant Penguin scoffed, even chuckling at his own joke.
“Yeah, or maybe you should’ve poisoned him over a candlelit dinner. Worked with me,” Dent mumbled angrily as well.
“Sorry to disappoint Harv, but at least my plan wasn't exactly one-sided,” Ivy replied curtly.
“Care to bet?” Two-Face snarled, brandishing his infamous coin.
The two former lovers exchanged glances, their eyes indicative of their downright murderous feelings towards each other. The former DA had been poisoned by Ivy, who had targeted him for his involvement in the construction of Stonegate Penitentiary, and the now turned criminal had kept a grudge, even despite his now split-personality.
“Now now, let’s not get out of hand here. Someone could lose an eye, and the last thing that anyone of us civilized people want is to start looking like Dent, am I right?” Joker smiled, playfully shuffling his cards.
Dent now turned his attention towards him, his blue, severely scarred flesh revealing itself in the light as he seethed at the Clowned Prince of Crime.
“Get out of my face clown,” he growled.
“Which one?” shot back the Joker playfully.
“The one that’s about to shut you up…...permanently!” came his firm response.
“Come now Harv, I’d hate to get your blood all over my new suit. After all, my dear Harley just got finished pressing it for me,” the Joker laughed, causing Two-Face to draw a .45 pistol from his suit as well.
“Gentlemen gentlemen, must we fight? After all, it is your turn, Dent,” the Penguin said bored, his sophisticated voice slurring over his own words.
“Yes, listen to Dr. Birdbrain Dent. After all, I’m not the one who tried to poison you,” the Joker pointed out, causing Dent to grab him by his collar all the way across the time. The Joker laughed weakly as Dent literally pulled him to his feet, pressing the muzzle of the gun against his bleached white forehead.
“Hey, I ever tell you guys about the time I fought Batman in the quarry?” Killer Croc suddenly spoke out.
“Shut up Croc!” the two yelled in unison.
“Gee, jump on the real freak in the room,” Croc mumbled miserably, as he leaned back in the chair.
“Thanks for reminding me clown. And say, you've been real lucky to survive this long against the Bat, what with him and the GCPD turning Gotham upside down looking for you. But we all know that everyone’s luck has to run out sooner or later. Let’s see if you’re as lucky as you are funny,” he snarls, brandishing the coin while simultaneously closing his fingers around the Joker’s throat.
“Say Harv, didn't Mommy ever tell you that pointing at someone was downright rude? I’m gonna have to take that coin away from you,” the Joker chided weakly, Dent’s fingers still wrapped around his throat.
“I’m gonna end you clown, but lets see how many times it takes the coin to agree with me,” Two-Face smiled, holding the coin up for the Joker to see.
Just when it seemed that the situation couldn't be even more palpable, the seductive voice of the former botanist burst through the tension.
“Now now boys, no need to fight over little old me!”
The two instantly twirled around to see Ivy, who flashed them both seductive smiles. They looked on in bewilderment as she yawned, feigning boredom, before leaning back on her chair and resting her boots on the table. She playfully twirled around a strand of her fiery red hair as they continued to glare at her.
“And besides, I never finished my story,” she added, causing Dent to narrow his eyes irritably.
“You had your turn witch. Now before I off this clown, I’m gonna tell of the time I nearly snuffed out the Bat,” he declared triumphantly.
“Or the time your breath nearly caused global warming in the West Indies,” the Joker added, still chuckling despite his predicament. Two-Face cocked his pistol, his index finger closing around the trigger.
“Heads I put a bullet in your thick skull right here and now. Tails I tie you up to a railroad track, and watch your insides get splattered all across the tracks. Either way, I win!” he snarled.
“Suit yourselves. You’re only missing out on what’s shaping up to be a grand affair. Still, I guess killing yourselves is better than knowing what ever became of our dear Dark Knight,” Ivy smiled cryptically, causing them to both freeze in their tracks.
Penguin immediately stopped dealing cards, a renewed interest in his eyes. Croc was dumbfounded, his reptilian eyes widened in shock.
“I thought I killed him with the rock,” Croc mouthed out loud.
Two-Face reluctantly let go of Joker’s suit and turned back to the vixen.
“You got five minutes witch. I don’t like what you’re spewing, and you get a bullet in the head too,” he said, before returning to his seat.
“Yes, for once I agree with the walking slot machine. I haven’t had that cold chill of a certain someone stalking me since I put a bomb in the mayor’s evening pie. More on that later,” the Joker smiled, straightening his tie.
“I agree with the clown. My operations have been running smooth lately, something quite peculiar given the nocturnal nature of the Batman. Consider me piqued as well,” the Penguin agreed.
"So what happened to the Bat?" Dent demanded.
"Funny you should ask dear. Why don't you ask Batman himself?" she added, a knowing smile in her face as she reached for her boot. Penguin narrowed his eyes as her gloved fingers grabbed the shoe. But instead of reaching inside of it, Ivy merely tugged at the leather before dramatically sliding the boot off, revealing her bared foot.
The quartet of villainy were almost captivated by the siren as she unveiled her left foot, a bared beauty if any other. Her foot, petite just like her, was pale white, not a single blemish on it. Her toes were surprisingly adorned in pitch black nail polish, and she wiggled them sexily as they continued to stare at her. Dent was unimpressed, while Killer Croc sat with his mouth wide open, revealing his razor sharp teeth. Joker continued laughing, and Penguin smirked as he twirled his cigar in his mouth.
Ivy held the boot in one hand, the other hand curled around the wooden chair.
"Excuse the gesture boys, but my piggies haven't breathed in days now," she smiled playfully, continuing to flex her toes.
"Uhhhhhh...nice nail polish Ivy," Croc complemented slowly, his eyes focusing on her toes.
"Awww, well aren't you a doll Croc. I figured you boys might enjoy it, given that its a nice little transition into business of my own," she added, before brandishing the shoe.
Dramatically, she reached into the boot, and pulled out something that would take them all by surprise, if not utter disbelief: the mask of the Batman.
The cowl of the Dark Knight, once the symbol of fear amongst all criminals in Gotham City, was now an ordinary piece of fabric in the hand of Poison Ivy, her fingers stretching through the eyelids. Two-Face snarled in disbelief, and the Joker gaped out loud, his usual playful attitude gone. The Penguin nearly spat out his cigarette, and drool now slid down Croc's mouth.
"That's....not...funny," came the Joker's blank reply, drained of his usual flair.
"Intriguing. It appears that our toxic temptress has finally gotten the upper hand on the Dark Knight. How utterly, utterly surprising," the Penguin mused after a brief silence.
"Isn't that what Batman used to wear?" Croc asked.
It was only Two-Face who snapped out of the initial shock and slammed his fist into the table.
"Hold it witch. What kind of sick joke is this?" he roared, much to Ivy's utter delight.
"Hark who's talking," Joker replied, in a obligatory sort of way.
"I assure you Harv, that this is no mere illusion. I am living proof of this," she pointed out, to which he jumped out of his chair, a murderous glare in his eyes.
"Not for long you ain't!" he roared, aiming his pistol at her.
"Please Harvey! Do you really want to kill the same person who did what none of you could do, and defeated the Batman? I think the coin agrees with me," she pointed out smartly, causing Two-Face to reluctantly take his seat.
"I believe explanations are in order, Mrs. Isley," the Penguin prompted.
"Yes of course. Now, as I was saying before I was so rudely interrupted," she smiled, relishing the villain's shocked expressions for a moment before continuing her story.

9:45 PM, The Rooftops, Downtown Arkham City
Catwoman, why me? Because dear Nightwing, I know you'll help me. I'm only stealing from the people who stole from me, so I'm not stealing. Where did you get the stuff in the first place? I stole it. You give her that look. What can I say. I'm a cat burglar. She smiles at you. Whatever. So who stole from you? Well I already kicked Two-Face's ass and took my stuff back. But with him being obsessed with the number two and all, he only had half. His goons have the rest. That's why I need your help. Why not just ask Batman? I thought you two had a thing? We do. But with his morals and all. I knew he wouldn't help me, so that's why I asked you. Works for me. So do I get some kind of reward for all my trouble? I'll think about it. She says as she runs her gloved hand down your chest and winks at you.
Two hours later... After Catwoman takes down the last goon, she picks up her duffel bag and starts walking back to her apartment. Um, Catwoman? Follow me and you'll get your reward. She again winks at you.
11:45 PM, Catwoman's Apartment, Arkham City Residential District
Catwoman throws her duffel bag in a closet and sits on her couch. So? Oh. Right. Your reward. As a reward for helping me, you get to rub my pretty little paws. Huh? My feet smart guy. How is that a reward? Oh please. You think I didn't see you stare at my feet every time I kicked a guy in the face or wrapped my legs around a guys neck? I uh... Admit it. You have a foot fetish dont you? What if I do? Then it's only that much more fun for you. Plus these boots kill my feet! Fine Catwoman, you win. Selina Kyle, you? Nightwing... Cmon, I'm not even wearing a mask. You can trust me with your secret identity. Batman trusts me with his... Fine... Dick Grayson. Weren't you in the circus when you were a kid? Yeah, my family was the famous Flying Graysons, of course that was until my parents were killed by a mob boss... I feel bad for you now, little Nightwing's parents were taken from him unfairly, just like Bruce... Catwoman takes off her boots and flexes her socked feet. The natural smell of a woman's sweaty feet is starting to get to you. Any minute now you'll be in a haze... You take off your gloves and grab one of Selina's feet. You slowly start rubbing her foot and she starts... Purring? She really takes the cat thing too far... Mmmm... That's nice. You know you're really good at this. I can never get Bruce to do this, not even when we're in our civilian clothes. Now that I think about it, you do look familiar. I remember you from when I was a little kid. Ding ding. Lightbulb moment. Why dont you take my socks off now? It'll be better for both of us that way. She says as she winks at you. She must get pretty lonely if she's really as sexual as she acts... You peel off both of her socks and admire her shiny black nail polish. She wiggles her toes to get your attention. Hi, Catwoman here. I did ask for a massage not a staredown. Sorry. The night is young, and the moon is full. Tonight's a good night to go on patrol. Your speed, strength, and healing factor get a boost when the moon is full. Word around the superhero community says that Catwoman is planning to hit the jewelery stores tonight. And who better to take down a cat than a dog... than a wolf... When you transform, you can do it one of two ways. The more apelike bipedal form you use when you need a big strength boost, and the stealthier quadrapedal form that's alot quicker and looks kinda like a big wolf, you can pass for a Husky in this form, allowing for deep infiltration. That's why you're one of the best vigilantes in Gotham. You decide to go Husky tonight... wolf tonight... and try to get the drop on Catwoman. You causually walk into the jewlery store, the guards see you and think nothing of it. Now, you wait... Presumably hours pass and everything seems normal. That is, until guard #3 doesn't show up. The guards always turn that one corner every 15 minutes... A few minutes pass and the other two guards never round the corner either... She must be here... You casually peek your head around the corner and see none other than Catwoman, helping herself to the many types of jewelery. You sneak behind her and prepare to strike. But Catwoman turns around with cat-like reflexes and ties you up with her whip. You could go beast mode and break out this predicament. But then you lose the element of surprise. Mangy mutt. Who lets a dog into a jewelery store anyway? Who am I kidding, dogs dont talk. Catwoman finishes up and drags you with her, presumably to her hideout. I'll teach you to sneak up on me, dumb dog. A little while later you arrive with Catwoman at her apartment.
Catwoman's Apartment
On your way in her cat hisses at you, which you respond to by growling at it. Dont you threaten Isis you stupid dog! Catwoman bops you on the nose, which actually really hurts... Catwoman puts out a bowl of milk for Isis and only glares at you. She is really not a dog person... Ok little doggie. Time for your obedience training... And dont you dare bite me, or this whip... is gonna be used as a whip. Catwoman walks over to you and begins untying you, now is your chance, now is your time to strike. Cats are your natural enemy... and laser pointers... stupid dog urges... Instead of attacking her, as soon as you're untied, you happily wag your tail and pant. You're peppy. I'll have to nip that in the bud immediately... Your tail stops wagging and finds it's way between your legs. Good. You know who's in charge. Now sit! Your butt immediately hits the floor. Roll over. You do as Catwoman asks and roll over for her. Speak. This is embarassing, I know I look like a Husky. But I'm a werewolf for crying out loud! Oh. So you're the one known as Kyore. What are you talking about? I'm just a regular old talking dog is all... You just said that you were a werewolf. There's only one werewolf in Arkham City. Curses... My cover is blown... I also know a few things about you. She says taking a a more seductive tone. She begins unzipping her boots, causing your hind leg to involuntarily thump up and down and your tail to wag. This savage beast is easily tamed if you know how... Curse her... she knows my one true weakness... She completely pulls off her boots, the natural smell of her feet hitting you instantly. And with your dog... wolf... nose, it has 10 times the controlling effect on you. You slowly walk toward her feet. Ah ah ah. Turn back into a human first. You do as she wishes. Good boy. Now come get your reward. She says as she wiggles her toes...

The night is young, and the moon is full. Tonight's a good night to go on patrol. Your speed, strength, and healing factor get a boost when the moon is full. The city's been unusually quiet tonight. This is a really big stride forward in diplomatic relations with the notoriously isolationist Amazons. They were supposedly made for Athena to wear during her long nights planning stratagems for battles the next day. The were then gifted back to the Amazons and passed down from queen to queen, granting any who wore them the wisdom and power to conquer any enemy. Apparently even Wonder Woman has worn them!
